name: p,p'-dicyanobiphenyl
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base melting point: 30 degrees Celsius. Two phenyl groups, which would add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The dicyanogen group (N#C) introduces two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would significantly augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
